medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one month after laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass and cholecystectomy. They initially presented as poor oral intake, intermittent passage of watery stool, dark urine, and suprapubic and epigastric pain. Eighteen days before admission, diffuse, crampy abdominal pain recurred and improved with intravenous fluids. Eight days before admission, abdominal pain recurred, leading to re-admission. After repeated episodes, the patient developed persistent lower abdominal pain and red urine, along with poor appetite, lightheadedness, generalized weakness, nausea, and cold sweats.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, anxiety, dermatographism with pruritus, facial hyperpigmentation after sun exposure, and facial hirsutism. A total abdominal hysterectomy and oophorectomy were performed due to leiomyomas and dysfunctional uterine bleeding.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, diabetes mellitus, and cholelithiasis.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, lives with one daughter, works in an office, Italian ancestry. Stopped smoking 20 years prior, does not consume alcohol or use illicit drugs.
